translation: Sutra on the Protection of Body and Life
That person believes in the Buddha's wonderful teaching, cultivates it, and doesn't forget it.

source_sentence: 六者不貪世榮斷俗因緣。
translation: Sixth, they don't crave worldly prosperity and cut off mundane causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 七者願習聖慧為一切護。
translation: Seventh, he wishes to cultivate noble wisdom and protect all [sentient beings].

source_sentence: 八者願集眾生為作倡道。
translation: Eight, he wishes to gather sentient beings together for the purpose of creating an advocate for the Way.

source_sentence: 九者在所墮生常願值佛。
translation: Nine: He always wishes to meet the Buddha in the births he falls into.

source_sentence: 十者守持禁戒廣度群生。
translation: Ten, he observes the precepts and extensively liberates sentient beings.

source_sentence: 十一者博學眾智宣示四輩。
translation: Eleven, he widely learns the wisdom of many people and proclaims the four groups.

source_sentence: 十二者常願與佛世世相值廣說道要度人無量。
translation: Twelve, he always wishes to meet the Buddha from generation to generation, explaining the essentials of the path and liberating measureless people.
These are the twelve noble wise ones.
The Buddha told Ānanda.

source_sentence: 若有比丘尼優婆塞優婆夷國王子及諸婇女。
translation: "Suppose there are bhikṣus, nuns, laymen, Upāsikā princes, and ladies of the land.
If there are people who can practice these twelve things.
They'll always attain Buddhahood in the births they fall into.

source_sentence: 周旋教化長離眾苦入三法門功得成就。
translation: He'll go around teaching them, free them from suffering, enter the three Dharma entries, and accomplish their success.
They'll quickly reach the Buddha and just step into the three realms.
There's nothing to obstruct, and there's no one who can stop it.

source_sentence: 自五前世修行此事自致得佛。
translation: From five previous lives, their cultivation of this thing will naturally lead to attaining Buddhahood.

source_sentence: 若有國王大臣長者中宮眷屬及諸善男子善女人四部弟子。
translation: If there are kings, ministers, elders, midshipmen, retinues, and good men, good women, and four groups of disciples.

source_sentence: 欲求此無上道廣度一切者。
translation: They want to pursue this unsurpassed path and extensively save them all.
They should also read this sūtra.
Those who want to pursue the teachings of the three vehicles.
They should also read this sūtra.
Those who want to achieve early deliverance from worldly inactivity should also read this sūtra.
He should also read this sūtra.
Those who want to be reborn up in the heaven of marvelous bliss should also read this sūtra.
He should also read this sūtra.
Those who want to pursue the life of a wheel-turning sage king should also read this sūtra.
He should also read this sūtra.
Those who want to be honored and wealthy should also read this sūtra.
He must also read this sūtra.
If there's a woman who wants a man's body, she'll read this sūtra, too.
He must also read this sūtra.

source_sentence: 欲求世世常與明師相隨教化者。
translation: Those who want to be taught by a wise teacher who will always follow them from generation to generation should also read this sūtra.
You should also read this sūtra.
Thus, these are all desires that are vested in him.
They should all read this sūtra.
This sūtra is venerable and vigorous.

source_sentence: 善男子善女人能奉行持此經者。
translation: Good sons and good women who can consecrate and uphold this sūtra will always be addressed by the authoritative power of the buddhas in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 常為十方現在諸佛威神所護。
translation: They'll always be protected by the authority and spirits of the buddhas of the present in the ten directions.
They'll also be protected by the seven buddhas of the past.

source_sentence: 及諸尊菩薩大弟子所護為。
translation: They were also protected by the seven buddhas of the past and by the great disciples of the honored bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 又天龍鬼神日月五星二十八宿一切諸尊天等。
translation: Also, gods, dragons, ghosts, the sun, moon, five stars, twenty-eight constellations, and all the honored gods and so forth.
They always follow and protect someone who reads this sūtra.
He'll never be killed unintentionally.
All the evil ones won't be able to harm him.

source_sentence: 是善男子善女人行菩薩之道故。
translation: That's because good sons and good women practice the bodhisattva path.
All the sages in the ten directions will guard and look after him.
The virtues of someone who reads this sūtra are limitless.
The Buddha doesn't say this twice.
'This is a sūtra for those who hear it ...
Those who memorize it and those who write it down ...
They'll get everything they wish for.

source_sentence: 阿難汝好諦聽諦聽受持是經。
translation: Ānanda, listen well! Listen closely! Accept and uphold this sūtra!

source_sentence: 懃教一切人受學諷誦讀之。
translation: Strenuously teach all people to accept, train, recite, and read it.
Don't forget to read it.
Ānanda then said.
"I've been taught by the Bhagavān.
When the Buddha spoke this sūtra, there was an elderly woman named Sunil in the audience.

source_sentence: 坐中有長者女名曰善信。
translation: There was an elderly woman named Shanxin sitting there.
She and 500 of her peers rose up at once.
She bowed her head at the Buddha's feet and threw her five bodies to the ground.
They knelt down and said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊信等女人罪穢嬰身。
translation: "Bhagavān, these women of faith have committed crimes and defiled themselves as babies.
By the Buddha's kindness, we've heard the noble teaching.
We don't wish to be disciples because we're women of low social status.
The Buddha said.
"Good, come, women!
'You were blessed in the past and should have attained Buddhahood.
Those who are happy to hear the Dharma will really be able to escape suffering.
You'll be born in a place that's far removed from the body of a woman.
The Buddha accepted the five precepts as a woman of pure faith.
Everyone in the congregation rejoiced.

source_sentence: 各前以頭面著地悉受五戒。
translation: They each bowed their heads to the ground and received the five precepts.
The Buddha told Ānanda.
"Good faithful women and others have long been born in the world.
When they hadn't heard of the Buddha, they hadn't heard of the Dharma.
They were blamed by their enemies.
Depending on the causes and conditions of the world, they might disparage the right teaching.
Some may break down stūpas and temples.
They might kill real people.
They might carry the three honored ones' possessions.
Sometimes they kill their parents.
Or they may transgress numerous enemies.
They don't realize their own wisdom.
The multitude of sins they commit cannot be counted.
Now, they've attained a vision of the Buddha.
Their minds are opened, and their thoughts are liberated.
They then realize that what they did in a previous life was wrong.
We believe that from now on we'll be the same group.
We'll change our abodes, cultivate our comforts, and uphold the Buddha's venerable precepts.
We'll also uphold this sūtra.
We won't violate it from generation to generation.
May the Buddha have mercy on us and grant us all the five precepts.
The Buddha told the women.
"Listen closely, accept, and uphold them.

source_sentence: 一者守仁不殺恩及群生。
translation: One, guard kindness and don't kill people who are kind to others.

source_sentence: 二者義護不盜損己濟眾。
translation: Two, guard righteousness and don't steal to the detriment of yourself and help others.

source_sentence: 三者貞潔不婬行無沾污。
translation: Three, you must be chaste and not lewd, and your conduct must be unsullied.

source_sentence: 四者言不詳[言*奇]不犯口過。
translation: Four, speaking without elaboration [speech*qi] doesn't offend your speech.

source_sentence: 五者遠酒不飲不犯眾怨。
translation: Fifth, he avoids alcohol and doesn't drink it, and he doesn't transgress the enmity of others.
He cultivates purification and always conducts himself with great kindness.
I wish for all honored ones to cultivate the Buddha's words.
He'll never regret it.

source_sentence: 任力所能寧守善而死不犯怨而生。
translation: Rather than transgress enmity, he'd rather abide in goodness and die than transgress enmity and be born, regardless of his ability.
Since then, you've kept the Buddha's precepts.
They've been praised by the gods.

source_sentence: 莫德隨俗邪罔跪拜鬼神護持禁戒。
translation: Maudgaly follows the conventional, mistaken, and reckless, prostrating before ghosts and spirits to uphold the precepts.
It's like pulling up one's hair.
He sits and observes his body.
His form doesn't soon stand up.
Their form doesn't last long, and they don't understand it.
His life is like the wind when he meets little illness like a man inside.
Don't hold yourself in disdain and conduct yourself with disrespect.
All things are impermanent.
You must cultivate diligence and abandon worldly aspirations that undermine them.
Follow the bodhisattva's path and vow to arouse his aspiration.
What do you want to pursue in this world or the next?
If he wishes, he'll get them all. They'll never be in vain.
The Buddha told Ānanda.
"You must guard your practice to attain Buddhahood.
The Buddha Way can't be studied without it.
You mustn't stop studying the sūtras and the Dharma.
Now, I've attained Buddhahood only as a result of accumulating study.
The marvelous Dharma of the great vehicle.
There are no men, no women, and no noble or base people.
Those who hear this sūtra will be protected by the buddhas.
The buddhas will bless and protect him.
They'll obtain everything they desire.
When the Buddha spoke this sūtra.

source_sentence: 天龍鬼神帝王人□及四部弟子有三億人。
translation: There were 300 million gods, dragons, spirits, emperors, kings, humans, and the four groups of disciples.
Seeing the Buddha teach this sūtra, they were all overjoyed and praised it as unprecedented.
They were all overjoyed and praised as unprecedented.
Each one aroused the intention for the unsurpassed true path.

source_sentence: 前以頭面著地作禮奉行。
translation: They bowed with their heads on the ground and handed down prostrations.
The Buddha told Ānanda.
"Listen closely, accept, uphold, and disseminate it.
Cause all sentient beings of every kind and shape to accept, read, recite, write, and make offerings to him.
Make offerings by memorizing, reciting, writing, and making offerings.

source_sentence: 佛之要法能除無數劫極重之罪。
translation: The Buddha's essential teaching can remove the most serious sins of incalculably long eons.

source_sentence: 能度無量無邊阿僧祇眾生悉得解脫。
translation: It can save measureless, unlimited, and incalculable sentient beings who will all attain liberation.
This sūtra comes out of the Buddha's mouth.

source_sentence: 有□讀一句一偈讀嘆之者。
translation: Anyone who reads a line or verse from it will praise it.

source_sentence: 眾邪違道一切怨鬼不得來近。
translation: "When many evils and paths are violated, all resentful spirits won't be able to come near them.
Their life will be long and they'll never die horribly.
Whatever they desire, they'll obtain it as they wish.'
When he spoke this sūtra.

source_sentence: 一切大眾及諸龍鬼神四部弟子。
translation: All the members of the crowd and the four groups of dragons, ghosts, and spirits who were his disciples.
They bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet.
They accepted the teaching of the goddess and wholeheartedly approved of it.

source_sentence: 正光二年十二月十五日　信士張阿宜寫護身命經受持讀誦供養經。
translation: On the fifteenth day of the twelfth month in the second year of Zhengguang's reign, the faithful monk Zhang Ayi wrote, memorized, recited, and made offerings to the Sutra on Protecting Body and Life.
Up there and in the seventh lifetime, his parents.

source_sentence: 下及己身皆誠善[口*弟]之道。
translation: From the top down and for himself, he sincerely cultivates the good [oral*digital] path.
